metadata.title: CVE-2019-5164 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the ss-manager binaryof Shadowsocks-libev 3.3.2. Specially crafted network packets sent toss-manager can cause an arbitrary binary to run, resulting in codeexecution and privilege escalation. An attacker can send network packets totrigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5164` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libshadowsocks-libev2 - 3.3.3+ds-3
shadowsocks-libev - 3.3.3+ds-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: shadowsocks-libev package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.3+ds-3').
